action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
X X X X X
DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with an "X" in the third column of every row, and a row of "X"s in the last row, with blank squares (▢) elsewhere.

Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with an "X" in the third column of every row, and a row of "X"s in the last row, with blank squares (▢) elsewhere.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your grid have an "X" in the third column of every row, consistently across all rows?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with some cells filled with X and the rest empty (represented by ▢), specifically: 
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X X ▢
X X X X X
QUESTION: Does your grid have an "X" in the third column of every row, consistently across all rows? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the third row of your grid?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s in the third row of your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are all the "X"s in your grid confined to the last row and the third column of the other rows?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Are all the "X"s in your grid confined to the last row and the third column of the other rows? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your grid have two consecutive "X"s in the fourth row?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Does your grid have two consecutive "X"s in the fourth row? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any blank cells (▢) in the last row of your grid, aside from the ones already described as having "X"s?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are there any blank cells (▢) in the last row of your grid, aside from the ones already described as having "X"s? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s above the row that has all "X"s?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Are there any "X"s above the row that has all "X"s? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.

ANSWER: No
